item.title: Users of Forecaster and Dynamics GP
item.description:
Have you ever encountered a problem where you vaguely recall a solution but can’t seem to locate the specific article or link? This happened to me recently with a client attempting to use their Dynamics GP user ID for Forecaster 7. As expected, it was unsuccessful due to GP’s encryption method when generating user IDs in SQL. This encryption prevents the same ID from functioning in Forecaster, even with proper database permissions...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/users-of-forecaster-and-dynamics-gp/

item.title: Time for IT and Users to Embrace Our IoT Overlords
item.description:
By: John Shepler The Internet of Things (IoT) is currently a popular topic in the tech world. There’s a lot of discussion about connecting everything to the internet, but some are urging caution and calling for standards and bandwidth. While many believe we’re on the brink of a technological revolution, history suggests we should be cautious about assuming only positive outcomes. Could there be negative consequences to the rise of the IoT?..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/time-for-it-and-users-to-embrace-our-iot-overlords/

item.title: Who is it, what is it, forecaster?
item.description:
To help new Forecaster users understand its intricacies, let’s break down the relationships between Forecaster, its users, data sources, and FRx. The Forecaster database, created after installation using the Forecaster Database Creation Wizard, stores all the relevant data. During creation, a database owner is assigned, who can then manage periods within the Forecaster application itself. Users can interact with Forecaster through either the web interface or the client application. While both offer data access, input, and reporting functionalities, the client application provides additional features for administrators...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/who-is-it-what-is-it-forecaster/
